description: Update the list of tags applied to an AWS Elastic Beanstalk resource. Two lists can be passed: TagsToAdd for tags to add or update, and TagsToRemove. Currently, Elastic Beanstalk only supports tagging of Elastic Beanstalk environments. For details about environment tagging, see Tagging Resources in Your Elastic Beanstalk Environment. If you create a custom IAM user policy to control permission to this operation, specify one of the following two virtual actions (or both) instead of the API operation name:  elasticbeanstalk:AddTags  Controls permission to call UpdateTagsForResource and pass a list of tags to add in the TagsToAdd parameter.  elasticbeanstalk:RemoveTags  Controls permission to call UpdateTagsForResource and pass a list of tag keys to remove in the TagsToRemove parameter.   For details about creating a custom user policy, see Creating a Custom User Policy.
